choices.A: Yes, because the stage plan should remain in "draft" status until It has been reviewed by project assurance
choices.D: No, because the stage plan should be modified to avoid the risk introduced by these new resources
choices.B: Yes, because the stage plan should remain in "draft" status until risks have been assessed and appropriate action taken
choices.C: No, because once risks have been recorded in the risk register, the stage plan can be approved by the project board

discussion.content: Yes, because the stage plan should remain in "draft" status until risks have been assessed and appropriate action taken.

questions.question_text:
The project manager is developing the stage 3 plan. The project manager is concerned that lots of new team members will join the project in stage 3. This risk to delivery has been recorded in the risk register. As a result, the stage 3 plan has been saved as a `draft` until this risk has been assessed. The project manager discusses the risk with project assurance before deciding what to do.
Is this an appropriate application of the 'plans' theme, and why?

choices.B: Yes, because the team plan should be reviewed by the senior supplier before they approve it
choices.C: No, because confidential milestones should not be included in a supplier's team plan
choices.D: No, because the team plan should be agreed between the project manager and team manager
choices.A: Yes, because the team plan should include the required contractual milestones

discussion.content: Yes, because the team plan should include the required contractual milestones.

questions.question_text:
The contract with the external consultancy for the 'e-learning course' states that payments will be made to the supplier on completion of specified milestones as defined in the stage 3 plan. The project manager is concerned that there is insufficient detail in the team plan to enable the milestone payments to be aligned with the stage plan. As a result, the project manager has asked the team manager to include this information in the team plan and discuss the revised plan with the senior supplier before resubmitting it.
Is this a correct application of the team plan, and why?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Table 20.4 in the official manual (under the 'Closing a Project' process) explicitly highlights the requirement to produce a Lessons Report as part of project closure.

A. Yes, because a lessons report must be produced as part of the 'closing a project' process.

This answer correctly highlights that producing a lessons report is an essential component of the 'closing a project' process in PRINCE2. Documenting how the issue was resolved and ensuring it is included in a formal lessons report aligns with the 'learn from experience' principle, ensuring that valuable insights are captured for future reference.

questions.question_text:
During the delivery of the initial pilot course, an issue was raised about the technology defined in the 'training venue specifications'. During project closure, the project manager confirmed that the issue was recorded in the issue log and an entry in the daily log recorded how it had been resolved for the remaining pilot courses. The project manager then produced a related lessons report.
Is this an appropriate application of the 'learn from experience' principle, and why?

choices.D: No, because a lessons report should have been produced as soon as the issue was resolved
choices.C: No, because the issue was resolved and the remaining pilot courses were not impacted
choices.A: Yes, because a lessons report must be produced as part of the 'closing a project' process
choices.B: Yes, because a lessons report is used to support the lessons log if more information is required

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -

RISK -
A risk event has been identified that the 'amended course booking procedures' may not be completed on time. The effect would be that the procedures would be too late to include in the pilot of the courses and they may not meet corporate quality standards.
Here are three actions relating to the risk.
Which role (A-F) should perform the action?
Choose only ONE role for each action. Each role may be used once, more than once, or not at all.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content: Project manager (advise on risk), Project manager, Team manager
B. Yes, because the risk management approach should include the tools and techniques to be used for risk management

choices.D: No, because the risk management approach is approved by the project board in the 'directing a project' process
choices.B: Yes, because the risk management approach should include the tools and techniques to be used for risk management
choices.C: No, because the risk management approach should specify the use of the corporate risk management tool
choices.A: Yes, because the project board should approve the risk management approach in the 'directing a project' process

questions.question_text:
During the initiation stage the Corporate Quality Manager advised the project manager that ABC Company's risk management tool should be used by the project.
The project manager prefers an alternative tool and has documented this in the projects risk management approach which has been approved by the project board.
Is this an appropriate application of the risk management approach, and why?
